last_episode_to_air.name: Yes We Scan
last_episode_to_air.overview: With the school in danger of being shut down, the gang hatches a plan to save the day. Meanwhile, Quinn and Tammy embark on a drug-fueled vision quest.

name: Those Who Can't
overview: There are teachers who inspire, enlighten, and challenge us. These are not those teachers.

episodes.name: The Boys Are Coming Together
episodes.overview: When the school bully begins picking on some of the teachers at Smoot High, the teachers exact a terrible (and stupid) revenge... and even the librarian gets in on the action!

episodes.name: Oof, Nut City
episodes.overview: Principal Quinn tasks the guys with helping a shy kid win the student election, but they do their jobs a little too well and unwittingly create a monster. Abbey and Quinn have a fight over Smoot High's debate practices.

episodes.name: Lady and the Skamp
episodes.overview: The teachers protest poor working conditions by going on strike, Shoemaker and Abbey butt heads over who's the real strike leader, and Loren and Rod tailgate the event...leaving Quinn and Tammy to man the understaffed school.

episodes.name: The Fairbell Tape
episodes.overview: Shoemaker and Abbey work to get the vending machine returned after it's removed by the PTA. Later, Loren clashes with his old teacher while Fairbell's sexual orientation is discovered.

episodes.name: Of Lice and Men
episodes.overview: After a lice outbreak at Smoot, Loren takes matters into his own hands and commands the "hot zone." Shoemaker and Tammy square off in a haircutting contest, while Abbey revisits some not-so-fond high school memories.

episodes.name: What's Eating Uncle Jake?
episodes.overview: After leading the JV Girls Volleyball team to the State Championship, Fairbell gets benched when the PTA appoints a new coach. Plus, Shoemaker takes asst. coaching a bit too far, and Loren schemes for a shady game sponsor.

episodes.name: For Whom the Bell's Tolls
episodes.overview: The guys come to school drunk on the day Superintendent Carson promises to fire the worst teacher. Shoemaker has a medical flare-up, Loren maintains a buzz in order to save face, and Fairbell makes a ridiculous new friend.

episodes.name: Wet Dreams May Come
episodes.overview: Shoemaker is tormented by a disturbing sex dream, and the drama teacher wrongly advises him to act on it. Meanwhile, Fairbell befriends the new school police officer even though the rest of the gang tries to get rid of him.

episodes.name: K-Pop Goes the Weasel
episodes.overview: A former student leaves a threatening letter for the gang, and they quickly realize they're stuck in the middle of his sick, murderous game. Trapped in school at night, with corpses piling up, the teachers fight for survival.

episodes.name: Take a Wonka on the Wild Side
episodes.overview: The teachers relive their glory days at Senior Prom, Fairbell and Abbey's "friend date" is a disaster, Quinn has the worst night of his life, and Shoemaker's looming divorce helps him get his angry band back together.

episodes.name: Rod Man Out
episodes.overview: With the dreaded new school year right around the corner, the teachers get a surprise when Rod returns to Smoot a sober man; his new insufferable attitude forces the gang to do the unthinkable to get him back to his old self.

episodes.name: Foreskin in the Game
episodes.overview: Shoemaker seeks emergency medical help from Abbey; Fairbell takes on a role assisting Cattie, Smoot's new principal; Loren is left alone in the dust.

episodes.name: Plains High School Drifter
episodes.overview: Cattie hires a former Denver Bronco to be Smoot's new head football coach, and he appoints Loren as his assistant. But the new coach's methods don't sit well with Tammy and Shoemaker, who go to great lengths to fire him

episodes.name: 8 Mile High
episodes.overview: Obsessed with the underground rap scene, Loren recruits Shoemaker and Fairbell to join his crew. Meanwhile, Abbey gets caught up in the local gang life, and Shoemaker and Rod butt heads over his relationship with Rod's mother.

episodes.name: White Guilt Trip
episodes.overview: After Abbey accidentally discovers Smoot's racist past, Cattie brings in Native American students to make-up for the bad publicity. Plus, Rod and Loren start a craft brewery on campus, but find that their success may be short-lived.

episodes.name: The Trial of Geoffrey Quinn
episodes.overview: It's Principal Quinn's trial. Shoemaker, Abbey, Fairbell and Loren have been summoned to the witness stand. Meanwhile, Cattie enlists Leslie to communistically transform Smoot into a passable school for an incoming reporter.

episodes.name: Detergent Dawn
episodes.overview: Loren finally completes his novel, but the book's success goes to his head, forcing Shoemaker to become his 'agent.' However, when the novel sparks a hookup outbreak, Fairbell and Summer's abstinence class takes a dramatic turn.

episodes.name: A New Dog in the Yard
episodes.overview: After being appointed interim wrestling coach, Fairbell starts a beef with the rival school's coach, who Abbey has a crush on. Plus, Shoemaker takes testosterone, and Loren deals with a new girlfriend - and her two children.

episodes.name: Mid-Bryce Crisis
episodes.overview: When a former Smoot senior returns to school, Loren, Shoemaker and Fairbell get paranoid about being the victims of yet another senior prank. Meanwhile, Abbey begins to date a younger guy despite warnings from Tammy and Julie.

episodes.name: All's Fairbell
episodes.overview: Against all odds, Fairbell excels in his new role as principal, but the arrival of a buttoned-up guidance counselor jeopardizes the rest of the gang’s easy street.

episodes.name: The Running of the Bullies
episodes.overview: Quinn returns as principal and starts a campaign to tackle the rampant bullying at Smoot, but disturbing the delicate social ecosystem has consequences for everyone.

episodes.name: You Can't Go Homecoming Again
episodes.overview: With the gang in charge of the homecoming parade floats, tensions rise and class warfare

episodes.name: A Smoot Holiday Coincidence
episodes.overview: The Smoot teachers rally around a student as they raise money for his heart transplant.

episodes.name: Escapegoats
episodes.overview: With the gang trapped in a Smoot “escape room,” new guidance counselor Steven leads the charge to get them fired.

episodes.name: Taco Tuesday
episodes.overview: As Tammy desperately tries to take care of an urgent personal matter, Smoot deals with a crisis of its own: a taco-less Tuesday.

episodes.name: One Ding-Wonder
episodes.overview: When a Smoot student becomes a viral sensation, Shoemaker gets a brush with fame, and Loren and Abbey try to out-viral everyone with a video of their own.

episodes.name: Grisly Man
episodes.overview: Out in the woods for a cross-country race, the gang stumbles upon a hermit they believe is a legendary serial killer.

episodes.name: Those Who Could've
episodes.overview: The Smoot faculty exploits student-teachers from a local university.

episodes.name: SKAppily Ever After
episodes.overview: Everyone chips in to throw Loren and Jade a dream wedding at the school. Meanwhile, Abbey wants to take her anonymous online relationship to the next level.

episodes.name: Big Ol' Scams
episodes.overview: Steven's vocational career fair has Loren and Abbey questioning their professional paths. Meanwhile, Shoemaker and Fairbell join a cult-like pyramid scheme.

episodes.name: Abbey's Road
episodes.overview: Abbey enjoys success at her new career away from Smoot. In her absence, the gang struggles with their altered group dynamic and Loren takes over as librarian.

episodes.name: Yes We Scan
episodes.overview: With the school in danger of being shut down, the gang hatches a plan to save the day. Meanwhile, Quinn and Tammy embark on a drug-fueled vision quest.
